function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential rebound in NO2 emissions and other pollutants after relaxation of COVID-19 regulations (revenge pollution)","Impact":"Reversal of environmental gains and increase in air pollution levels","Mitigation":"Implement strict emission controls and monitoring, promote sustainable transportation, and invest in renewable energy sources","Technologies":"Air quality monitoring systems, emission control technologies, electric vehicles, and renewable energy infrastructure","People":"Residents in areas with high pollution levels, vulnerable populations, and wildlife","Owner":"Government, environmental agencies, and public health organizations"},{"Description":"Climate recovery may be temporary or reversed due to economic activities returning to normal","Impact":"Permanent environmental damage, loss of biodiversity, and increased health risks","Mitigation":"Enforce strict environmental regulations, invest in green technologies and infrastructure, and promote sustainable practices","Technologies":"Renewable energy sources, green building designs, carbon capture technology, and sustainable agriculture methods","People":"Global population, future generations, and wildlife","Owner":"Government, environmental organizations, and businesses"},{"Description":"Demand for regular lockdowns to manage environmental risks in countries like Qatar","Impact":"Disruption of economic activities, social challenges, and potential resistance from the population","Mitigation":"Develop sustainable environmental management strategies, invest in resilient infrastructure, and promote community engagement","Technologies":"Remote work technologies, sustainable urban planning, climate-resilient infrastructure, and public health monitoring systems","People":"Residents in pollution-affected areas, vulnerable communities, and wildlife","Owner":"Government, environmental agencies, and public health organizations"}]}
